website_summaries.verdict: The Excursion TR 9 from Saucony offers durability, comfort and breathable coverage to trail runners. The trail-specific outsole delivers reliable traction on technical terrains and impressive underfoot protection while the upper of the shoe wraps the foot comfortable while giving support throughout the run. This trail running shoe is designed for neutral runners.
pros: The mesh and synthetic upper maintain breathable coverage that’s comfortable at the same time
The soft fabric lining and padded interior secure the foot and make it easier for the foot to stay in place, according to some testers
The Molded IMEVA makes up the bulk of the mid-sole cushioning system, which is responsible for the lightweight underfoot support and shock absorption
A significant number of runners noticed the reliable impact protection in the heel area
The outsole unit of the Excursion TR 9 was able to provide durable protection and traction over the trails based on some comments
The Saucony Excursion TR 9 is affordable
cons: The men’s version of the Excursion TR 9 is moderately heavy
Some runners noted that it was stiffer than the previous version
Others criticized the low-quality stitching, which easily got loose
A few felt that it was a bit narrow in the forefoot area

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Looks black in pic but def grey. Love them. Very comfortable, ventilated, and stylish. Colors arent loud.
customer_reviews.author: marlin3030

customer_reviews.title: "running" causes me great pain in my Achilles
customer_reviews.text: I am a not thin, active woman. Running..."running" causes me great pain in my Achilles, probably because of my weight, or maybe because of my high arches. I bought these because I kept switching between types of Asics and my feet were in pain. These feel like I am not even running on pavement. I honestly don't feel the ground beneath me and after three running sessions of roughly 4 miles each, I am not in any pain. I already have a second pair in my cart; I'm just going to keep them in stock.
customer_reviews.author: desibatts

customer_reviews.title: Like running on clouds!
customer_reviews.text: I just got these today. I wear this brand to run outside (on concrete) with my dog. Now that the weather is turning colder, I wanted something that would help grip the road when it's snowy and icy, so I ordered these trail shoes. They are amazing. As soon as I put them on, I could feel the cushioning. They fit perfectly. I usually wear an 11 (yes, bigfoot here) and these fit as expected. I have a narrow heel, and these fit perfectly. I am a neutral runner with a normal arch. I went running outside with my dog tonight and they have great support. I love these shoes!!!
customer_reviews.author: Reptile Mama

customer_reviews.title: Finally--a shoe that fits my feet!
customer_reviews.text: I am 70 years young, have a bunion and wear orthotics. With arthritis in my feet, finding the right shoe is near impossible. After 6 months of searching and having returned 9 pairs of sneakers, this Saucony shoe is the right one for me. The foot inserts are easily removed to fit my orthotics. This 7-M pair (I usually wear a 6.5) is wide enough to fit comfortably around my bunion, and after wearing them around the house for a week to make sure there were no hot spots, I decided this pair was it! Thank you Saucony. Finally--a shoe that really fits my feet comfortably. Hurray!
customer_reviews.author: hc

customer_reviews.title: Only shoe I will run in.
customer_reviews.text: These are just my favorite brand and model of shoes. I've been wearing this model for years now. When I tried on my first pair it was this wonderful cloud of comfort that felt like 360 degrees of cushioning. As an oversupinator/non-pronator, these are the only running shoes that I can tolerate on both trails and asphalt/cement. I struggled with other more expensive brands and still experienced lateral plantar fasciitis. i've not had any such issues in my trusty saucony excursions!
customer_reviews.author: ClaudiaTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoe. I was having foot problems and decided ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe. I was having foot problems and decided to get these shoes in hopes of walking with less pain. It was so nice that my foot didn't hurt while wearing these, and not much when they were off. I would wear them for hours at a time and my feet felt great!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this model, not usual quality
customer_reviews.text: I love Saucony and have been buying nothing else for years but these were a huge disappointment. They lasted less than a month before the support was gone and I can usually go a year. I'd say it was a fluke but Igor 2 of the same shoe And the same thing happened with both--and one shoe the tie loop broke so I couldn't lace all the way up anymore.
customer_reviews.author: themominator

customer_reviews.title: Classic shoe that supports well
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves the shoes and she is very finicky. We tried many shoes. She had the Saucony TR2 from a long time ago and we've been trying to replace them, but she's never been happy with anything. Yesterday, she wore these for a couple of hours and said that they support her heels and ankles like the TR2 did, and she loves it. She likes the blue/grey color too, which is more subdued than all the other loud combinations that seem to dominate today. So, our search is finally over. Will be buying a 2nd pair.
customer_reviews.author: Zacharia

customer_reviews.title: Love These Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a half size up from my normal size and they are perfect. I did add a heal pad into it and if you like a cushion feel, you may want to add a full shoe pad, but all in all, they are great. I am a 66 year old with arthritis in my feet and toes and walk between 4 and 5 miles per day, so these shoes get a work out and even with the arthritis they don't cause a ton of pain. As I mentioned, there is not much padding so I added a heal pad. There is plenty of room in the toes for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: These were a great substitute for several weeks of day hikes ranging from ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes prior to a hiking trip in california as my previous shoes were wearing out. I traditionally avoid hiking boots because they tear up my toes, literally. These were a great substitute for several weeks of day hikes ranging from 3-5 miles to 12 miles. Toes box very comfy. Support as needed (I have a neutral arch, am 5'7" and weigh 160lbs). It took me 2 1/2 years to wear through them (not just insoles, which I replace about every 6-9 months, but the outer plastic mesh started to break down from general wear and tear) but they were used for the equivalent of a few 100 miles. Great trail sneaker for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Minordetails

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite hiking shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned many Saucony but this was my first pair of hiking Sauconys. I’m a true 8 and ordered 8.5 because my in-store purchases always ran small. These are true to size so the 8.5 was too roomy but I kept them & I’ve worn these 4 months. I have weak ankles and a wide foot. They’re perfect: cut high enough on ankle to provide support, wide with generous toe box & the traction is great, showing minimal wear. I hike approx 16 miles on weekends through a nature reserve with steep inclines & declines, some rough terrain, and these have held up great. I’m ordering an 8 right now for a thru hike next summer.
customer_reviews.author: Thru Hiker Lady

customer_reviews.title: The perfect shoe for me...
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Don't mess with a product that works. Saucony is the most comfortable shoe I have ever worn. But I found out the hard way to not try to buy a cheaper model and to stick with what works. The Grid Excursion TR9 works for me and is what I will stick with. If you have a job where you work on your feet all day, you can expect to replace them about every 6 months in order to not experience pain.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Gone seem to be the models with great arch support and side to side stability
customer_reviews.text: If you are a hard core Saucony wearer, these are the cheap, low end ones. Gone seem to be the models with great arch support and side to side stability. They are suitable for around the town, but NOT jogging class Sauconys.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: The Excursion line shoes have fit the best so I stick with them
customer_reviews.text: Saucony shoes seem to fit my feet while most other brands are uncomfortable for me. I would say I have kind of flat feet. The Excursion line shoes have fit the best so I stick with them. The price is always reasonable but I wish they lasted a little bit longer. I tend to get a hole in the top of the shoe above my big toes after about 6 months but I don't know if that has more to do with the shoe or my own feet quirks.
customer_reviews.author: CLS CA 71

customer_reviews.title: Saucony excursion
customer_reviews.text: Other than trying them on and walking around the house, due to feet and feet of snow In my yard, I can't really say how well they work on a trail. I don't run but walk a lot in the mountains and want a shoe with an aggressive tread which this one does. It also has a roomy toe box compared to the "grid" which I tried on at the same time. I bought my usual size 9 and would say they are plenty big. Fit a little bigger than the grid. Nice color. I should be able to use them by June.
customer_reviews.author: trpsmom

customer_reviews.title: Love Saucony Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love Saucony running shoes, have been buying them consistently for years. The shoes hold up well, have great cushioning, firm support. I wear them both inside and outside for distance running. Grateful for the black color, especially when I retire shoes from running, this will make a great every day shoe. These shoes fit well. In many other brands, the heal is too wide and the back of the shoe moves too much or the foot bed for toes is too narrow. These shoes fit where they should and give space where needed.
customer_reviews.author: T. Boyce

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor running
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. The support and cushioning are perfect for me, and the toe box has plenty of room. The "grippy" soles are perfect for outdoor walking/running. I walk and run on trails that are sometimes gravel, unevenly paved, or covered in pine needles and leaves. I always feel like I have good traction in these.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly C

customer_reviews.title: I usually love saucony. These were terrible
customer_reviews.text: I returned these. I usually love saucony. These were terrible. They felt like cardboard instead of cushion. I don't use these for running, just to walk the dogs etc. They have always been so comfortable in the past. I'm not sure what happened. These were so awful I felt rubbing in the Achilles on a half mile walk with the puppy. Stiff, unresponsive, they look cute but feel cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Available in WIDE sizes
customer_reviews.text: Heaven help the shoe shopper with wide feet! My wife can look at everything in DSW and find maybe one pair that fits. She loves Sauconys. She knows that she can order wide sizes in some of their models and that they are guaranteed to fit well and provide good cushioning and support. These trail runners look like they will have good support and traction for uneven surfaces. Saucony, if you are reading this, please make even more models in wide.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H. Costello

customer_reviews.title: Saucony hits another home run!
customer_reviews.text: I normally purchase the Saucony Women's Cohesion Road Running Shoe for my athletic activities, and often for my all day continuous wear when I know I am going to be spending a good portion of the day on my feet. I decided to try the Grid Excursion to see how it compares, as it is listed as a trail running shoe. I find that it too is an excellent fit and extremely comfortable. I purchased a pair of New Balance running shoes less than two months ago and decided that my feet just needed that extra that I get from Saucony.
customer_reviews.author: Melody A. Meyers

customer_reviews.title: My favorite!
customer_reviews.text: I love Saucony shoes! They are so comfortable and last forever. Fit is true to size- perfect for wider feet like mine. I have several pairs of the Tr9's in different colors and love all of them. I get a lot of compliments on these new teal blue shoes with the burgundy accents! Being a nurse I need a comfortable shoe to stand in for 8-10 hours a day and these are the only shoes that don't make my feet hurt at the end of the day- and I have tried alot of different brands. They are very "cushiony" and provide support in all of the right places. Well made shoe, looks good too- highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mah

customer_reviews.title: Go back in time, OLD MODEL BETTER!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace worn out TR6 which I loved and fit perfectly. Why do companies feel they have to keep changing something that's already good? The fit is not the same. They are a bit big and wide. Comfortable but, I need to wear thick socks.
customer_reviews.author: old house lady

customer_reviews.title: good for person needing a broad width shoe
customer_reviews.text: I do not like my shoes to fit tightly across the top of my foot. These shoes accommodate a broad width foot. If you have a tender upper foot these shoes are great. They help stabilize my balance at the gym and on the street. I own several pairs. Good quality and hold up well. Worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Marcy Silk

customer_reviews.title: TR9's are great
customer_reviews.text: I love Saucony and I love this style. I have the other 2 colors the TR9's come in as well. The fit is perfect. There is a sleeker fit to these. Not bulky or heavy in anyway. I play pickleball in them several hours 3 days a week and walk about 30 miles a week on a dirt and paved trail. Slightly wider than other brands. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Lizotr

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not ideal for thin feet
customer_reviews.text: I got one of this shoes and used in different terrains. It's not the best for pavement, since it's not designed for that. It has good grip on dirt terrains, however it was very loose on my feet. I have thin feet and these shoes do not allow me to tighten the laces too snuggle, so my feet are "dancing" inside the shoe, which is not a good thing when hiking. I would recommend this for wide feet, if you have narrow like mine, go for Asics trail shoes.
customer_reviews.author: zeborinha

customer_reviews.title: Great sneaker, but recommend switching out the laces
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of this exact shoe. I put in arch support inserts because my feet and ankles are horrible. Only thing that stinks about these is that the shoelaces will loosen up or untie after a few hours. Must be the fabric of the laces themselves, but both my pairs of sneakers suffer from the flaw.
customer_reviews.author: coorsy k

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes after back surgery!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes for a while now and still love them! They have not fallen apart like some others have mentioned. I've had 3 back surgeries so I was looking for shoes that were comfortable and gave me support which these did. They are roomy in the toe area and give support to my arch and heel. Before back surgery, I use to run in Saucony shoes and they were extremely comfortable then. I'm so happy they are still making incredible shoes that I can exercise in with my back condition. These shoes also have great tread and the width has helped me a lot with my balance. I would completely recommend these shoes!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: The Best Yet!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit even better than my other Saucony shoes. I got them for hiking since I need the runner-type bottom instead of one that is not flexible. I chose black so the shoes wouldn't look so awful after a day hiking on mountain trails. They are so comfortable, I am sure I will be wearing them for everyday use, particularly walking! I typically wear Thorlo socks with them. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: doctor beach

customer_reviews.title: Love! So Comfy.
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! They're really cute and comfortable. I've been wearing them for about 10 days and they feel great. The fit is a bit wider than I expected, but they're perfectly comfortable and sizing down would make them too small. The color is definitely more gray than what appears in the product listing. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: These are very comfortable sneakers. I had the Grid Excursion TR8 and ...
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable sneakers. I had the Grid Excursion TR8 and wore them out, unlike other manufacturers, the sizing did not change with the model number, so they fit like a dream! great price too
customer_reviews.author: M L MTop Contributor: Quilting

customer_reviews.title: Love Saucony shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased Saucony shoes at a local shoe store. Unfortunately it went out of business. I've tried other shoes but after having foot pain, looked Saucony up online and purchased this pair. As soon as I put my feet in them I knew all would be well! I have short, wide feet with a narrow heel (6.5 with C/D width). These shoes fit well. I've had to go up a size on other shoes to accommodate the width and then my feet slide forward and my toes get pinched! I ordered another pair today, don't want to be without!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie in Washington

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes but questionable quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had these shoes for a while now and I really loved them. They are very comfortable and breathable. Soon after getting them I noticed the top of the ankle had separated from the rest of the shoe showing the inside padding. At first I thought my the dog got my shoe. Fast forward after a few more months. The other shoe had the exact same thing happen in the same exact spot. I love the look and comfort of these shoes but this is definitely something that Saucony needs to fix with the materials they use. The padding showing at the top of your ankles isn't exactly stylish. I haven't done much of anything but walk in these.
customer_reviews.author: Don B

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are great!! I have very wide and thick feet ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great!! I have very wide and thick feet and have trouble finding shoes that feel good since I was a baby. I always have to go a size up in order to get the width I need. The length of my foot requires an 8.5. I always order a 9.5, even when a wide width is available because my foot is that wide. I ordered these in a 9.5 and was surprised at just how wide they are. They fit very comfortably, even at the end of day when my feet are swollen. They provide a great level of cushioning also.
customer_reviews.author: InfoSec

customer_reviews.title: Work
customer_reviews.text: I just keep buying this style and color for work. The only issue I have had with these is that, the inside lining in the heel area, wears a hole and then I can't comfortably wear the shoes anymore. I think this happens because, I have to wear slip covers over my shoes, the covers add strain and my heels rub the inside of my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Colors but Decent
customer_reviews.text: They have a mushy unstructured fit, like lumps. However, I’ve never got blisters like I did with my new Vasques. The edges frayed and ripped. Of all my trail shoes, these have not held up. But everyone compliments the color of these. Now that these are worn in, I might try wearing them without socks. I’ve had to buy thin socks for less snug fit. I haven’t gained weight but these feel squishy and lumpy.
customer_reviews.author: Red House Woman

customer_reviews.title: Great price for quality sneakers
customer_reviews.text: These shoes run wide, which is perfect for me. These are light and comfortable and the heel does not dig into me, as most sneakers do. These were $10 less than a local retail sports store. I am very leased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Saucony or not? That's the question.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleasant shoes, and yes I have some walking and stability challenges. The shoes provide me with enough comfort. I have replaced the insoles with my own orthopaedic insoles. For the first few days my back didn't really like the shoes, but after a week or so they get along fine. ;-) My only hesitation would be that the Saucony name is nowhere to be found.
customer_reviews.author: Dame of Belair

customer_reviews.title: Fab shoes
customer_reviews.text: I think these are my first Sauconys and I have to say they are fabulous! Sooo comfortable!! Honestly much better than other shoes I have. They are light but yet give excellent support which is great for me as I have plantar fascitis. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: LadyNeal

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe for my body
customer_reviews.text: I have a few chronic conditions that make a great shoe hard to come by and these are wonderful. The arch support is awesome for my high arches, I've been wearing the same size and style of this shoe since 2011 and I'm sad it's almost gone from stock all over the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Kadie

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality; lasted less than a year with minimal wear
customer_reviews.text: I loved the shoes until this week when the shoe lace hole closest to the tip of the shoe RIPPED. The shoelace can no longer be threaded through that hole... making the shoes unwearable. After less than a year with approximately only once a week wear, I am jot satisfied at all with the quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A

customer_reviews.title: I do love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I do love these shoes. I hike 3 miles 5 days a week on a gravel trail. So far these shoes have held up nicely. I had to add arch support to my right foot but that is because I have a falling arch. My healthy left foot feels very comfortable in these shoes. I normally buy Asics,- in comparison these Sauconys have more cushion in the sole.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Baraccuda

customer_reviews.title: I'm pretty happy with these
customer_reviews.text: For someone a bit particular about their tennis shoes, I'm pretty happy with these. They are well-padded, cool and comfortable, the back is not too high, they are wide enough for toe-wiggle room and feel fairly supportive.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Lion

customer_reviews.title: Really love this shoe Great product Tr 5 I Miss!
customer_reviews.text: I fell in love with saucony years ago such a Great product. Became Dissapointed when you took away the TR 5's & changed the colors Igot the Black& hot pink trim still have them Love my white& hit pink but you took away that color made them too gray not as pretty sometimes change isnt always the best decision adding on new is okay,but taking away the best sellers hurts
customer_reviews.author: Shirley J.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: After my last sauconys split after 2 hikes I was Leary about purchasing another pair. I think they designed them a little different in the bend of the foot.(see the black reinforcement piece) These shoes are sooo cute. Solid but yet comfy. The only issue would be the laces not staying tight. I have been on 2 hikes over 5 miles each and I can barely feel the rocks and they are good on the loose gravel too.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Athmann

customer_reviews.title: I like these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes, I ordered them last year in a size 9W and they fit well. This year I went with their size chart and ordered an 91/2 W and it was too small, I have to send them back. So from year to year the sizes change. Otherwise a very good shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Almendarez

customer_reviews.title: Feel great!
customer_reviews.text: Coming off of wearing walking shoes for months...these shoes feel really great on my feet. I actually have a bounce in my step again and my feet and legs don't hurt nearly as badly as they did. I hope this lasts!!
customer_reviews.author: Angiebaby

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe, Own 2 Pairs!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, I owned one pair for 1.5 years and bought a second pair because they wear so well and are comfortable. The heels do not wear out so quickly and rub blisters on my feet. Love them compared to my old asis I used to buy. I put arch support inserts in these shoes, however, I do have a high arch and do this to most my shoes. Excellent ankle support, even with the arch support inserts in place. Recommend highly if you will be on your feet for 8+ hours.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite shoes to wear daily as I do a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite shoes to wear daily as I do a lot of walking, including dog walking and working in stores. I work with animals all day, and I need comfortable shoes to wear. The thread on them is amazing and non-slip.
customer_reviews.author: AZHikingGal

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe fits great! I usually need to order a wide but this toe box is perfect, not narrow like most shoes these days. I like the way they look and feel. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Annalie

customer_reviews.title: Overall great trail running shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are lightweight with good stability, especially at the inside heel as I slightly pronate. The mesh is solid enough that you get very little dirt inside. I normally wear a 7.5 and they are true to size, giving me enough toe room when I run. I have a slightly wider foot than average, but these shoes are not narrow and fit width-wise fine. Plus, they are super cute. I'd buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: JanetGrace1

customer_reviews.title: Cute but uncomfortable insoles with no arch support
customer_reviews.text: No arch support. Very disappointed because I love Saucony shoes. They are usually the only brand of athletic shoes I wear. But the insoles on these were not comfortable and had no arch support. I didn’t feel I should have to purchase special insoles just to make these comfortable. Too bad, because they were really cute and seemed well made. Had to send them back though.
customer_reviews.author: MDJeepGirl

customer_reviews.title: My feet are happy!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! I have long, narrow feet. No arches. These shoes are comfortable and cushion my heels great. I wear an 11 -toes don't rub on the ends! I bought these for the gym but confess to wearing them much more often. Lack of arches causes me knee pain, so i often wear them around the house for inside chores like cleaning. The support they give is at a comfortable fit is unmatched.
customer_reviews.author: sara jayne

customer_reviews.title: Great training and trail shoes
customer_reviews.text: great shoes. I have been running and racing for about 35 years and these shoes are as good as any I have used for training. I run daily on a combination of roads and very rocky trails and these shoes work very well. My orthotics fit in these shoes, much like my Brooks and New Balance.
customer_reviews.author: brooks w booker III

customer_reviews.title: Where the cushion?
customer_reviews.text: Shoe fits great but there is absolutely no padding. I had to buy a cushioned insert so I can continue to use them. I've used them so I can't return them. I love Saucony just can't figure out where all the cushiony padding went like they used to have.
customer_reviews.author: Acctthis

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I am not brand loyal to many companies, but Saucony is one I don't stray from often. And when I do I'm usually sorry. I am NOT sorry I bought these. they are very comfortable and provide good support. I use them mainly for walking the dog, and they are perfect. They probably wouldn't be great for heavy duty running, but that's not what they are designed for. Two thumbs up and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Eva M. Powell

customer_reviews.title: light, cheap, small, no support
customer_reviews.text: This shoe seemed very cheaply made. They had no support, was made in China and very poor design in my opinion. I've owned saucony's for years and every year they change their shoes a bit...I'm not a fan
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sneakers
customer_reviews.text: These sneakers are the most comfortable pair of sneakers I have ever owned. I wear them every day and take walks in them and they are fantastic! I wore them all weekend running errands but also going to the local fair and at the end of the day my feet did not hurt at all, unlike my old sneakers that by the end of the day my feet were killing me.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin LaPlante

customer_reviews.title: my favorite go to walking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I don't run but I walk, and these are great. Super lightweight, but sturdy and they breathe. Nice wide toe box. I remove the insole and place my custom orthotics in for support. Only Sauconys I buy now.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: ... last year in size 8 and it was the perfect shoe, well made
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item last year in size 8 and it was the perfect shoe, well made, durable and nice looking. Price was right for an athletic shoe that was used for walking, running and some cross training. Bought exact item again in size 8 and it was too small. Returned that and purchased the "recommended 1/2 size" up. Now too big in the toe box. This makes for unstable support, balance and leads to tripping. Very disappointing. This was an excellent shoe. Now the sizing has changed and will have to look elsewhere. Saucony has really screwed up.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes !
customer_reviews.text: This was my second pair of these shoes. The first pair I wore out so when I saw these on Amazon I decided to get another pair. These shoes fit me perfectly and they are very comfortable. I have problem feet so if I find a pair of shoes that feel good ,I tend to stick with that brand and the exact shoe when possible, Good looking and comfortable !!
customer_reviews.author: young at heart

customer_reviews.title: Favorite shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite shoes! I used to wear a pair that was four times as expensive but would only last six months. Then get a hole in the toe and smooth on the bottom from wearing the tread off. No worries with these!!! These last so much longer with the thick tread and no holes! Love, Love, Love! I have three pairs!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Haire

customer_reviews.title: Work Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I wear these shoes for work. I'm on my feet 3/4 of an 8 hour work day.The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is the insole is a bit hard. Not as cushiony as other styles I have owned by this company. Have worn them for 2 weeks now and my feet feel fine at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: dsdrdh

customer_reviews.title: Value for money!!
customer_reviews.text: ...so i like this sneakers, it's very comfortable and it feels as though I am sprinting in it, somehow it gives me extra lift. When I first received it, it didn't appear to be very padded like my last saucony however it feels just as comfortable, maybe even better. I went horseback riding in them and I intend to go hiking soon so perhaps i'll update but so far very pleased with the sneakers for the price it was selling at. Good job saucony!!... P.S the colours don't appear similar to the picture advertised, it's actually prettier in real, I thought that it was pink and grey however it's more like a bright/flourescent orange/pink...pretty nice
customer_reviews.author: cindy eastman

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe for all different types of activities.
customer_reviews.text: These are great trail runners. I love all Saucony trail runners. They're the most comfortable, rounded shoe I've found for all sorts of different activities from trail running to hiking, to group fitness in the gym. The only reason I'm giving them four stars instead of 5 is that I like the Saucony Peregrine trail runners even more.
customer_reviews.author: chusar

customer_reviews.title: Really is a wide size
customer_reviews.text: Too often I've purchased shoes claiming to be wide width. I even returned a pair of a competitor brand because they cut off my circulation despite being "wide width." Not so with these Saucony's. I love them, and I have worn them since I got them. The fit is true to size, the shoe itself is very comfortable, and I will stick to this brand from now on. Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: mamavee

customer_reviews.title: My favorite walking shoes
customer_reviews.text: My favorite walking shoes! This is my third pair. Extremely comfortable! I wore these on our European vacation last year and on many adventures since. I still have all three pairs and wear them for different purposes: light hiking and camping, city walking, every day use. Love them! The perfect walking shoe, in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Nice and cheap
customer_reviews.text: I am very surprised by how durable they are, specially considering the price, though I could not say I am much of a runner
customer_reviews.author: mabs

customer_reviews.title: finally a comfy running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have a wide foot bed. I can wear a 6 or 6.5. My trainer has these and recommended them. NO BREAK IN REQUIRED. Wow its like a cloud on my foot. (or feet). I LOVE THESE so much I just ordered another pair. FAVS.
customer_reviews.author: make time to enjoy

customer_reviews.title: Finally, shoes that fit!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd pair of Saucony shoes I have owned. Fit perfectly. Lightweight. Good tread. Breathable. I am not a runner, but I probably walk 40 miles a week in them. Also - I have always struggled with finding shoes that fit my feet well. It was kind of a miracle when I tried the first pair on and they were comfortable and fit right. Love this brand!
customer_reviews.author: littlegreenmom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect TRAIL/RUNNING shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I was so surprised at how much I love these shoes! The grip is awesome for hiking and trail running and I also use them to run on the treadmill and they're super comfortable. I haven't even put in my own own insoles yet; Just using the ones that came with the shoe. Loving these!
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, great price
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Saucony shoe buyer for years. This particular pair of shoes is a fabulous fit (I have wide feet) and was the most economical pair I found anywhere. I am trying to decide whether or not to buy another pair just like them or to see if I should get them in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: dissreader

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, terrible lateral support
customer_reviews.text: Very light, very comfortable but terrible lateral support. Even a slight slope and the side of the shoe collapses. This is a great everyday shoe but I would not wear it for running or hiking on trails. It's too bad because I really like the fit and comfort. Mine are now relegated to lawn mowing duty.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Michel

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: VERY comfortable shoes for walking. I walk my dogs twice a day, every day, and these lasted over 6 months. Now I wear them for yard work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are so comfortable! I need to get a spare pair
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so comfortable! I need to get a spare pair!! They feel better than the new brooks adrenaline gts 16 and at a better price!!
customer_reviews.author: labchic97

customer_reviews.title: great fitting out of the box
customer_reviews.text: These fit right out of the box, and usually, even with running shoes, I have an uncomfortable period of pain and blisters as my wide feet stretch out shoes that are supposed to be wide, but are always too narrow. They have a great amount of cushioning, important because other shoes have given me plantar fasciitis. I have bought Saucony shoes before, and they have been good, but not this good. Great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: April Violet Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: These are very comfortable shoes and an extremely good value
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable shoes and an extremely good value. I had been looking at other trail runners for quite a bit more money and wasn't sure that trail runners would be good for me but these exceeded my expectations. I am a hiker and have always used boots for hiking but noticed that lots of through hikers were using trail runners. I decided to give it a try and they were amazing. It was a local hike but still had elevation and the grip on rocks was very good. I still have not been brave enough to use them in the whites but for local hiking 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: My order delivery

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Excursion TR9 Running shoe is a good all-around sneaker.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are still new to me and haven't seen much action, but so far, I am highly pleased with them. I've had Saucony shoes for for years and I like them as much as most brands. They are priced right and are comfortable, too.
customer_reviews.author: Curious George

customer_reviews.title: Immediate Comfort!
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, comfortable immediately. I used them on mountain trails as well as standard walking streets. Did 5 miles the first time out and they felt like a million bucks. I highly recommend these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered an 8 but returned for 8 1/2 because I thought my toe was too close to the end of the shoe. I absolutely love them! I am recovering from a jones fracture on my right foot & this brand was on a list of shoes my podiatrist had. They are PERFECT IN EVERY WAY!!! And Amazon had the best price : )
customer_reviews.author: 4HISGLORY

customer_reviews.title: but these are extremely comfortable. Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell yet how they hold up, but these are extremely comfortable. Lightweight. I use them for walking. Cushion-y, but not too much, good stability. And don't look huge on a women's sz 10 foot is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Jane K.

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: My podiatrist recommended saucony because the inserts come out and I can place my orthotics. This is my 2nd pair of the same shoe. I wore out my first pair. I love them! Only issue is the squeaking with the orthotics. So not a shoe problem, moreso a personal one I'm working on fixing.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect! They fit great
customer_reviews.text: I have a very high arch and have a hard time finding tennis shoes that I can wear all day long. I also want them to be light enough that they don't drag me down! These are perfect! They fit great, they are light and they have GREAT color choices. I have worn this brand of shoe for a long time and am never disappointed! Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. P

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: The shoes and no cushioning very hard. Keeping them but only using them in the gym. Not good for running if you need a cushioned shoe.
customer_reviews.author: vicki southwell

customer_reviews.title: I love the color
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with this brand of shoe. I love the color, weight and material of these shoes. They do not, however, have very much arch support. I will be adding arch support insoles to these to be able to comfortably walk long distances. I am leaving 4 star feedback because of the other aspects of the shoes that I mentioned earlier. They fit comfortably. I did order a half size bigger as I had seen suggested in other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Christian

customer_reviews.title: They fit fine except the width across the toes
customer_reviews.text: They fit fine except the width across the toes, could be a little wider. The sole needs to more firm and supportive to keep my ankle from rolling over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these hiking boots! I don't know that I'd actually run in them but I guess you could. I use them more for hiking trails with the dog and walking the neighborhood. Great support in a super light shoe. I bathe dogs and so I will often get splashed with water. They dry super quick and I can stand for long periods of time without my feet starting starting to hurt. And the price...👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave M

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed and had to return since walking in the house ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems the sole is very hard and very different from the same model I purchased 2 years ago in a sports shop (and I absolutely loved), it almost feel is a replica and not the real brand , I was very disappointed and had to return since walking in the house on hard wood made my feet hurt I purchased these to run on concrete trail but had to return it
customer_reviews.author: Green

customer_reviews.title: back to Asics!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely narrow... Not the shoe itself, but the sides so it looks like a manufacturing defect. Overall length is big, but the shoe looks too small. Very weird sizing. I've always loved Saucony, but terribly disappointed in these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: jessa271

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes! I bought them specifically to hike "Delicate Arch" at Arches National Park. The trail is very steep, sandy, and rocky. They performed well and they had no problems gripping the rocks as I hiked.
customer_reviews.author: Nette

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect! Very light weight and comfortable, didn't even have to break them in! Love the color, exactly what I was looking for! Definitely will be buying more of these!
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and versatile
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. I use them for a variety of activities and they are very comfortable. My one complaint is that the shoelaces come untied very easily. I'd recommend buying new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Delania Collins

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: I have had about 6 pair of these shoes all size 8. These were snug across the top and my big toe rubbed the front of the shoe. I returned them for another size.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love the Saucony brands. So comfortable & fits an insert so great on the feet. Color is cute & great quality. Will buy again. Only problem I have is that the netting above the toe always gets a hole in it after a year...
customer_reviews.author: Laura Swaft

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and fit
customer_reviews.text: Great for short hikes and for power walks in suburbia. I find that Saucony brand fits my feet consistently. Great to be able to avoid trip to a store. Good quality for cost.
customer_reviews.author: Eleanor Covan

customer_reviews.title: They fit just right & felt good at work
customer_reviews.text: They fit just right & felt good at work. My feet weren't tired & achey like they usually are after eight hours on my feet! Wish there was just a bit more cushion where the toes are though.
customer_reviews.author: deborah m.szlachta

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried about buying shoes on line because I am anywhere from a 8 wide in men's to a 10 wide in woman's depending on the shoe. I was pleasantly surprised that this shoe was a perfect fit at the 9 wide womans that I asked for. Good shoe, for the 6 days that I have had them, good support, good sole.
customer_reviews.author: CAA

customer_reviews.title: This shoe is not as good as the tr 6-7-8
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is not as good as the tr 6-7-8. The cushion is very thin compared to tr8. The sole is different and seems lumpy. Don't know why saucony cheapened the shoe, money savings I'm guessing.
customer_reviews.author: Butch P.

customer_reviews.title: SAUCONY WOMEN'S TRAIL RUNNING SHOES
customer_reviews.text: VERY HAPPY WITH THE FIT. HAVE WIDE FEET AND NOT ALL SNEAKERS ARE FULL CUT. TO PURCHASE A LONGER SIZE IS NOT THE CORRECT WAY TO FIT YOUR FOOT. NOT ALL BRANDS AND NOT EVEN THE ONES THAT CARRY WIDE CARRY WIDE IN ALL STYLES.
customer_reviews.author: LINDA C

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe without water crossings
customer_reviews.text: Overall good trail shoe for the price. Did a 7+ mi trail run in them out of the box. Gripped rocks well. No blisters. Toe box is rather small. Hold water way too much on stream crossings.
customer_reviews.author: Bicyclistetcetera

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoes; they provide awesome support. I have Guide 9 shoes and ordered the same fit, which in the Guide 10 is too big. The heels are a bit wider and my foot slips when I walk. I wish they fit! I'd love to keep them.
customer_reviews.author: garden

product_meta.title: Saucony Women's Grid Excursion Tr9 Ankle-High Trail Runner
product_meta.description: Running is good for the body and soul. Science has proven that endorphin rush improves mood and brain function. The recent resurgence of avid runners has driven the need for the next generation of shoes engineered specifically to handle the constant ground-pounding. Women's feet are different from men's, so running shoes are developed and fabricated with that in mind. Shock absorption, sole wear and stride variance are vital. Wearing the shoes with the right fit can be the difference between short sprints and marathons.
feature_bullets: Lightweight trail runner featuring breathable mesh panels and aggressive lugs
